I’d love if we collectively decided to blow the dust off a special little game that’s been sitting in our libraries for a long, long, long damn time.

Day of Defeat Source’s entry bar might seem daunting at first, as you need to have a decent knowledge of the ins and outs just to have a merely “decent” time in servers where you walk among gods who have over 3k hours of experience, but it has a lot of unique quirks that make it an experience that you’ll be hard-pressed to find in a modern shooter.

Movement feels snappy and precise but not *too* exploitable and you won’t find the bhoppin’ crowd. You also have a stamina meter that keeps you from running too much and forces you to move smartly so that you don’t have to stop constantly to replenish the bar.

The action is satisfying but not always immediate, there’s a lot of “down” time where maybe you’re just waiting for a target while sitting on your ass in front of a window with your light machinegun or sniper rifle. Then some dude behind you bitch-slaps you with a shovel and makes you think very bad things regarding their mother. 
But that’s a fundemental part of the experience.

The weapons feel great: excellent sound design, animations and impact but the recoil? Yeesh, get used to that. It’s worse than anything in Counter-Strike (and for a good reason too, I’d imagine that keeping a steady aim with a .30 cal in real life would be about as pleasant and easy as working at Activision)

The arcade-ish simplicity of an old-style shooter but the competitive, slow-paced, “check every corner because some dingus with a bazooka is sitting near the door frame ready to pulverize your kneecaps” type of mentality that modern shooters thrive on due to the increasing interest on ESports.

Of course, being on the Source engine, you don’t need to have your super powerful rig that you use to play your incredibly demanding titles such as Terraria and League of Legends. You can max this shit’s graphics on your mom’s 2010 busted laptop. Don’t believe it? Steal it and try it out yourself.

And, hey, the game looks great even now: what it lacks in its slightly off-looking textures it more than makes up for with its excellent modeling and fluid animations that make Back 4 Blood look like something a mentally underdeveloped monkey would code in an evening.

I especially like its attention to detail with cool little things such as helmets flying off the characters’ heads when shot and soldiers putting aside their weapons while running. It’s charming.

DoD: Source is an excellent mix of new and old that may not click at first, but could easily become a neat li’l surprise when you run out of things to try out in your never-ending backlog-traveling torture.

Who knows? A couple of hundred new players sure would not hurt. It's a great game, come and have fun.

* 𝑶𝑷𝑰𝑵𝑰𝑶𝑵 𝑬𝑺𝑻𝑨 𝑱𝑶𝒀𝑨

Este juego es muy bueno, al principio tenia miedo de que no estuviera vivo por alguna razón como que es demasiado antiguo y valve no se preocupa de el, pero para mi sorpresa si esta bastante vivo, las partidas son muy buenas, generalmente se encuentran mas jugadores de habla inglesa, pero en mis 243.3 horas de juego me ha tocado ver varios otros jugadores de habla hispana y de otros idiomas, la comunidad es bastante amigable, te hace sentir como si estuvieses jugando con un grupo grande de amigos, ya que en los servers siempre hay un grupo de varias personas hablando por micrófono. en fin, buen juego, lo recomiendo. lo único que aun no entiendo muy bien es que en ciertos momentos aleatorios la pantalla se me oscurece, no pasa siempre, una vez a las miles y no dura tanto, pero es algo que molesta un poco cuando estas muy concentrado.

* 𝑴𝑶𝑫𝑶 𝑪𝑶𝑴𝑷𝑬𝑻𝑰𝑻𝑰𝑽𝑶
Y qué decir del tan conocido lado del gamer, el competitivo. Con el tiempo se gana bastante experiencia en el modo versus, cientos de personas en todo el mundo haciéndose con la victoria en muchas buenas partidas, probando lo habilidoso que se puede ser.

Así que si no lo has comprado, compralo... que en algún momento estaré esperando jugar contigo :)

Comparing DOD:Source with DOD (classic) I realized that almost nothing has changed. All the same kind and positive people, the same atmosphere as before. There is even a server with Realism that surprised and delighted me a lot.

The only thing that still spoils the mood and the desire to play is a terrible return. If you like to shoot from a machine gun, I'm afraid to upset that this is a difficult task here.

If at least someone released a guide to recoil then it would be very fixable, otherwise you just have to move the mouse on the random to try to hit.

Online is very different from DOD, there are more people and there is a variety of game modes.

Один из лучших соревновательных шутеров.Напоминает CSS в сеттинге второй мировой, но при этом чуть менее динамичная, игра идёт до тех пор пока одна их команд не захватит все флаги или сервер не сменит уровень. Также очень понравились гранаты, они наносят куда больший урон и даже в мере от игрока может его убить даже если он на фулл хп, но при этом гранату можно взять в руки и откинуть назад во врага.

In the right servers (which there's a good handful) this game is pure gold. Amazing level design and gameplay with some extremely satisfying weapons. Fun tight knit community and they're also mostly friendly. A lot of FF servers which can be good or bad, but there's servers with that disabled too. Some of the controls can feel clunky at first but will grow on you and feel good over time. I hope Valve updates this game because it's still great today and I prefer to play this over TF2 and CS 1.6 or any other WW2 shooter. Keep DoD:S alive! Two dollars on sale, you can't beat it!
